sentences.text: LETTER TO SHAREHOLDERS FROM THE CHAIRMAN
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To our Shareholders:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is my pleasure to invite you to attend our joint Annual Meetings of shareholders at The Dorchester, 53 Park Lane, Mayfair, London W1K 1QA, United Kingdom on Wednesday, April 5, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The meetings will commence at 9:30 a.m., and although there are technically two separate meetings (the Carnival plc meeting will begin first), shareholders of Carnival Corporation may attend the Carnival plc meeting and vice-versa.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We plan to continue to rotate the location of the Annual Meetings between the United Kingdom and the United States each year in order to accommodate shareholders on both sides of the Atlantic.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are also pleased to offer an audio replay of the business portion of the Annual Meetings, which will be available shortly after the meetings at www.carnivalcorp.com or www.carnivalplc.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Details regarding the matters to be voted on are contained in the attached Notices of Annual Meetings of Shareholders and Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because of the dual-listed company arrangement, all voting will take place on a poll (or ballot).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your vote is important.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We encourage you to vote as soon as possible, even if you plan to attend the meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Boards of Directors consider voting in favor of Proposals 1 through 11 and 13 through 20 to be in the best interests of Carnival Corporation and Carnival plc and its shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the case of Proposal 12, the Boards of Directors have concluded that the vote to approve the compensation of our Named Executive Officers should occur on an annual basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the Boards of Directors unanimously recommend that you cast your vote FOR Proposals 1 through 11 and 13 through 20 and, in the case of Proposal 12, that you vote in favor of the vote to approve the compensation of our Named Executive Officers occurring on an annual basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Thank you for your ongoing interest in, and continued support of, Carnival Corporation & plc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sincerely,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: January 30, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Micky Arison Chairman of the Boards of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Who is Eligible to Vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Carnival Corporation Shareholders      Carnival plc Shareholders      You are eligible to vote if you were a     shareholder as of the close of business (EDT) on     February 6, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are eligible to vote if you are a shareholder as of 6:30 p.m. (BST) on April 3, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How to Vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To make sure your vote is counted, please cast your vote as soon as possible by one of the following methods:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Carnival Corporation Shareholders*          Carnival plc Shareholders          Using the Internet at www.proxyvote.com          Using the Internet at www.sharevote.co.uk        Calling toll-free 1-800-690-6903          Using CREST electronic proxy appointment service (if you hold your shares through CREST)        Mailing your signed form          Mailing your signed proxy form
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: * If your bank or broker utilizes Broadridge.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Otherwise, your bank or broker will provide you with instructions on how to vote
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All eligible shareholders may vote in person at the 2017 Annual Meetings of Shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please refer to details about how to vote in person in the Question and Answers section.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Important Note: If you plan to attend the 2017 Annual Meetings of Shareholders please see the Notice of Meetings for important details on admission requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Enroll for Electronic Delivery
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We encourage shareholders to sign up to receive future Notices of Annual Meetings electronically.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you have not already enrolled, please consider doing so as it is simple, saves time and money, and is environmentally friendly.

sentences.text: Meeting Admission Requirements:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attendance at the meeting is limited to shareholders and their duly appointed proxies or corporate representatives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each attendee may be asked to present valid government-issued picture identification, such as a drivers license or passport.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders holding shares in brokerage accounts (under a street name) will need to bring a copy of a brokerage statement reflecting share ownership as of the record date (February 6, 2017).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Due to security measures, all bags will be subject to search, and all persons who attend the meeting will be subject to a metal detector and/or a hand wand search.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will be unable to admit anyone who does not comply with these security procedures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On behalf of the Board of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ARNALDO PEREZ General Counsel & Secretary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Carnival Corporation is continuing to take advantage of U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) rules that allow it to deliver proxy materials over the Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under these rules, Carnival Corporation is sending its shareholders a one-page notice regarding the Internet availability of proxy materials instead of a full set of proxy materials, unless they previously requested to receive printed copies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you receive this one-page notice, you will not receive printed copies of the proxy materials unless you specifically request them.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instead, this notice tells you how to access and review on the Internet all of the important information contained in the proxy materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This notice also tells you how to submit your proxy card on the Internet and how to request to receive a printed copy of the proxy materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All Carnival Corporation shareholders are urged to follow the instructions in the notice and submit their votes using one of the voting methods described in the proxy materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you receive a printed copy of the proxy materials, the accompanying envelope for return of the proxy card requires no postage.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any shareholder attending the meeting in London may personally vote on all matters that are considered, in which event the previously submitted proxy will be revoked.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposals 1 through 18 will be proposed as ordinary resolutions.

sentences.text: For ordinary resolutions, the required majority is more than 50% of the combined votes cast at this meeting and Carnival Corporations Annual Meeting.

sentences.text: Proposals 19 and 20 will be proposed as special resolutions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For special resolutions, the required majority is not less than 75% of the combined votes cast at this meeting and Carnival Corporations Annual Meeting.

sentences.text: A shareholder entitled to attend and vote at the meeting is entitled to appoint a proxy to exercise all or any of their rights to attend, speak and vote in his or her stead.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To be effective, a duly completed proxy form and the authority (if any) under which it is signed, or a notarially certified copy of such authority, must be deposited (whether delivered personally or by post) at the offices of Carnival plcs registrars, Equiniti Limited, Aspect House, Spencer Road, Lancing, West Sussex BN99 6DA, United Kingdom as soon as possible and in any event no later than 9:30 a.m. (BST) on April 3, 2017.

sentences.text: Alternatively, a proxy vote may be submitted via the Internet in accordance with the instructions set out on the proxy form.

sentences.text: For this purpose, seniority shall be determined by the order in which names stand on the register of shareholders of Carnival plc in respect of the relevant joint holding.

sentences.text: PROXY STATEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors of each of Carnival Corporation and Carnival plc (together, Carnival Corporation & plc, we, our or us) is providing these proxy materials to you in connection with our joint Annual Meetings of Shareholders on Wednesday, April 5, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Annual Meetings will be held at The Dorchester, 53 Park Lane, Mayfair, London W1K 1QA, United Kingdom.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The meetings will commence at 9:30 a.m., local time, and although technically two separate meetings (the Carnival plc meeting will begin first), shareholders of Carnival Corporation may attend the Carnival plc meeting and vice-versa.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are furnishing the proxy materials to shareholders on or about February 24, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: he Notice of Annual Meetings, Proxy Statement and the Annual Report are available at www.carnivalcorp.com and www.carnivalplc.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2        Carnival Corporation & plc 2017 Proxy Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GOVERNANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are committed to governance policies and practices so that shareholder and other stakeholder interests are represented in a thoughtful and independent manner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sound principles of corporate governance are critical to obtaining and retaining the trust of investors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: They are also vital in securing respect from other key stakeholders and interested parties, including employees, our guests, suppliers, the communities in which we conduct business, government officials and the public-at-large.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Carnival Corporation and Carnival plc operate under a dual-listed company structure with primary stock listings in the United States and the United Kingdom.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, we have implemented a single corporate governance framework consistent, to the extent possible, with the governance practices and requirements of both countries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While there are customs or practices that differ between the two countries, we believe our corporate governance framework effectively addresses the corporate governance requirements of both the United States and the United Kingdom.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our corporate governance principles are set forth in our Corporate Governance Guidelines and the charters of our Board Committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The actions described in these documents, which the Boards have reviewed and approved, implement applicable requirements, including the New York Stock Exchange listing requirements and, to the extent practicable, the UK Corporate Governance Code published by the UK Financial Reporting Council in September 2014 (the UK Corporate Governance Code), as well our own vision of good governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will continue to monitor governance developments in the United States and the United Kingdom to ensure a vigorous and effective corporate governance framework of the highest international standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate Governance Guidelines, copies of the charters of our Board Committees and our organizational documents are available under the Governance section of our website at www.carnivalcorp.com and www.carnivalplc.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSALS 1-10 ELECTION OR RE-ELECTION OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Boards are elected by the shareholders to exercise business judgment to act in what they reasonably believe to be in the best interests of Carnival Corporation & plc and their shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Boards select and oversee the members of senior management, who are charged by the Boards with conducting the business of the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nominations of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Carnival Corporation and Carnival plc are two separate legal entities and, therefore, each has a separate Board of Directors, each of which in turn has its own Nominating & Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As the dual-listed company (DLC) arrangement requires that there be identical Boards of Directors, the Nominating & Governance Committees make one set of determinations in relation to both companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating & Governance Committees actively seek individuals qualified to become Board members and recommend to the Boards the nominees to stand for election as Directors at the Annual Meetings of Shareholders or, if applicable, at a Special Meeting of Shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Carnival Corporation & plc 2017 Proxy Statement     13
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GOVERNANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Election or Re-Election of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When evaluating prospective candidates for Director, regardless of the source of the nomination, the Nominating & Governance Committees will consider, in accordance with their charters, such factors as they deem appropriate, including, but not limited to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the candidates judgment
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the candidates skill
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: diversity considerations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the candidates experience with businesses and other organizations of comparable size
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the interplay of the candidates experience with the experience of other Board members
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the extent to which the candidate would be a desirable addition to the Boards and any Committees of the Boards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate Governance Guidelines dictate that diversity should be considered by the Nominating & Governance Committees in the director identification and nomination process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This means that the Nominating & Governance Committees seek nominees who bring a variety of business backgrounds, experiences and perspectives to the Boards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Boards believe that the backgrounds and qualifications of the Directors, considered as a group, should provide a broad diversity of experience, professions, skills, geographic representations, knowledge and abilities that will allow the Boards to fulfill their responsibilities and the Nominating & Governance Committees assess the effectiveness of this approach as part of the annual evaluations of our Boards of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of the date of this Proxy Statement, 30% of the members of the Boards are women (being three of ten members).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating & Governance Committees will also use their best efforts to see that the composition of the Boards adheres to the independence equirements applicable to companies listed for trading on the New York Stock Exchange and the London Stock Exchange.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating & Governance Committees may consider candidates proposed by management, but are not required to do so.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other than the foregoing, there are no stated minimum criteria for Director nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating & Governance Committees identify nominees by first evaluating the current members of the Boards willing to continue in service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of director succession planning, current members of the Boards with skills and experience that are relevant to our business and who are willing to continue in service are considered for re-nomination, balancing the value of continuity of service by existing members of the Boards with that of obtaining a new perspective.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any member of the Boards does not wish to continue in service or if the Nominating & Governance Committees or the Boards decide not to re-nominate a member for re-election, the Nominating & Governance Committees identify the desired skills and experience of a new nominee in light of the criteria above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Current members of the Nominating & Governance Committees and the Boards are polled for suggestions as to individuals meeting the criteria of the Nominating & Governance Committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Helen Deeble was identified as a potential board member by an independent board member.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating & Governance Committees engage a third party search firm to identify and attract potential nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate Governance Guidelines provide that our Non-Executive Directors, all of whom are currently independent, will meet privately in executive session at least quarterly.

sentences.text: Board and Committee Governance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committees assist the Boards in their general oversight of our financial reporting, internal controls and audit functions, and are responsible for the appointment, retention, compensation, and oversight of the work of our independent auditors and our independent registered certified public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors of Carnival Corporation has determined that each member of the Audit Committees is both independent and an audit committee financial expert, as defined by SEC rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Board of Directors of Carnival plc has determined that each member of the Audit Committees has recent and relevant financial experience for the purposes of the UK Corporate Governance Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Boards determined that each member of the Audit Committees has sufficient knowledge in reading and understanding the companys financial statements to serve on the Audit Committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The responsibilities and activities of the Audit Committees are described in detail in Report of the Audit Committees and the Audit Committees charter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committees have authority for reviewing and determining salaries, performance-based incentives, and other matters related to the compensation of our executive officers, and administering our stock incentive plans, including reviewing and granting equity-based grants to our executive officers and other employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committees also review and determine various other compensation policies and matters, including making recommendations to the Boards with respect to the compensation of the Non-Executive (non-employee) Directors, incentive compensation and equity-based plans generally, and administering the employee stock purchase plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For more information on the responsibilities and activities of the Compensation Committees, including the Committees processes for determining executive compensation, see Compensation Discussion and Analysis, Executive Compensation and the Compensation Committees charter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Executive Committees may exercise the authority of the full Boards between meetings of the Boards, except to the extent that the Boards have delegated authority to another Committee or to other persons, and except as limited by applicable law.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: HESS Committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The HESS Committees review and recommend policies relative to the protection of the environment and the health, safety and security of employees, contractors, guests and the public.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The HESS Committees also supervise and monitor health, environmental, safety, security and sustainability policies and programs and review with management significant risks or exposures and actions required to minimize such risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For more information on the responsibilities and activities of the HESS Committees, see the HESS Committees charter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nominating & Governance Committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating & Governance Committees review and report to the Boards on a periodic basis with regard to matters of corporate governance, including succession planning.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating & Governance Committees also review and assess the effectiveness of our Corporate Governance Guidelines, make recommendations to the Boards regarding proposed revisions to these guidelines, and make recommendations to the Boards regarding the size and composition of the Boards and their Committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For more information on the responsibilities and activities of the Nominating & Governance Committees, see Nominations of Directors, Procedures Regarding Director Candidates Recommended by Shareholders and the Nominating & Governance Committees charter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional information with respect to Carnival plcs corporate governance practices during fiscal 2016 is included in the Carnival plc Corporate Governance Report attached to this Proxy Statement as Annex C.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board and Committee Independence
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A majority of the Directors of each company, all of our Non-Executive Directors and all of the members of the Audit Committees, Compensation Committees, HESS Committees and Nominating &
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, all members of the Audit Committees and Compensation Committees meet the heightened independence criteria applicable to Directors serving on those Committees under SEC rules and New York Stock Exchange listing standards.

sentences.text: Risk Oversight
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Boards of Directors have overall responsibility for the Carnival Corporation & plc Enterprise Risk Management Program, which is designed to support the Boards by providing insights related to risk identification and mitigation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Boards use their Committees to assist in their risk oversight function as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Audit Committees are responsible for oversight of our financial and non-HESS controls and compliance activities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committees also oversee managements processes to identify and quantify the material risks facing Carnival Corporation & plc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with its risk oversight role, the Audit Committees regularly meet privately with representatives from our independent registered certified public accounting firm, the Chief Audit Officer and the General Counsel.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committees are responsible for oversight of risk associated with our executive compensation structure, policies and programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our HESS Committees are responsible for oversight of risk associated with the health, environment, safety and security of employees, contractors, guests and the public.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Nominating & Governance Committees are responsible for oversight of risk associated with Board processes and corporate governance, including succession planning.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each Committee Chairperson presents on its area of risk oversight to the full Boards for review.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Discussions with the Boards regarding the Carnival Corporation & plc strategic plan, consolidated business results, capital structure, and other business-related activities include a discussion of the risks associated with the particular item under consideration.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This oversight includes briefings by management, review of audit results and corrective actions, and results of risk assessment and risk monitoring activities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Boards believe that the structure and assigned responsibilities provides the appropriate focus, oversight and communication of principal risks faced by our companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Risk Assessment
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2011, Carnival Corporation & plcs management, in conjunction with the Compensation Committees independent compensation consultant, Frederic W. Cook & Co., Inc. (FW Cook), conducted a thorough review of our compensation programs, including those programs in which our Named Executive Officers participate, to determine if aspects of those programs contribute to excessive risk-taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the findings from this review and the annual reassessment, the Compensation Committees continue to believe that our compensation policies and practices do not encourage excessive risk-taking and are not reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect on Carnival Corporation & plc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To reach this conclusion, key elements of our compensation programs were assessed to determine if they exhibited excessive risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These elements included pay mix (cash vs. equity) and pay structure (short vs. long-term focus), performance metrics, performance goals and ranges, the degree of leverage, incentive maximums, payment timing, incentive adjustments, use of discretion and stock ownership requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our assessment reinforced the Compensation Committees belief that our
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GOVERNANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: compensation programs are not contributing to excessive risk-taking, but instead contain many features and elements that help to mitigate risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: shareholders in the short, intermediate and long-term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Incentive Limits: Our annual bonus plans do not allow for unlimited payouts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Bonus awards cannot exceed 200% of target levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance-based share grants made in 2016 limit the payouts to 200% of target, inclusive of the impact of the total shareholder return (TSR) modifier, if applicable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance-Based Share Grants: To strengthen the relationship between pay and performance, all of our equity grants to senior executives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Measurement: For corporate officers, the performance measurement used when determining their annual bonus is based on the performance of Carnival Corporation & plc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For officers of our operating units, the performance measurements used when determining their bonus is based 50% on the performance of their operating unit, with the remaining balance being based on the performance of Carnival Corporation & plc to enable a continued focus on the overall success of Carnival Corporation & plc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership Guidelines: All of our senior executives who are designated as reporting officers under Section 16 of the Exchange Act, including our Named Executive Officers, are subject to a Stock Ownership Policy which specifies target ownership levels of Carnival Corporation and Carnival plc shares for these officers in terms of the value of the equity holdings (including unvested restricted shares and restricted stock units (RSUs)) as a multiple of each of these officers base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Stock Ownership Policy requires that these officers retain at least 50% of the share awards received after deducting withholding taxes, until their target ownership level is achieved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Clawback Policy: The Carnival Corporation 2011 Stock Plan (which was approved by shareholders in 2011) and the Carnival plc 2014 Employee Share Plan (which was approved by shareholders in 2014) contain a clawback policy, which authorizes us to recover incentive- based compensation granted under those plans in the event Carnival Corporation & plc is required to restate its financial statements due to fraud or misconduct.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beginning in 2014, the incentive plans used to determine annual bonuses include a clawback policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance Guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate Governance Guidelines address various governance issues and principles, including Director qualifications and responsibilities, access to management personnel, Director compensation, Director orientation and continuing education and annual performance evaluations of the Boards and Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate Governance Guidelines are posted on our website at www.carnivalcorp.com and www.carnivalplc.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Chief Executive Officer Succession Planning
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Boards believe that planning for the succession of our Chief Executive Officer is an important function.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our multi-brand structure enhances our succession planning process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the corporate level, a highly-skilled management team oversees a collection of cruise brands.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At both the corporate and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: brand levels, we continually strive to foster the professional development of senior management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, Carnival Corporation & plc has developed a very experienced and strong group of leaders, with their performance subject to ongoing monitoring and evaluation, as potential successors to all of our senior executive positions, including our Chief Executive Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Boards and the Nominating & Governance Committees are responsible for succession planning, including emergency succession planning.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independent Non-Executive directors meet with the Chairman and the Chief Executive Officer (both together and individually) at least quarterly to plan for the succession of the Chief Executive Officer, including plans in the event of an emergency.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During those sessions, each of the Chairman and the Chief Executive Officer discusses his recommendations of potential successors, along with an evaluation and review of any development plans for such individuals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As provided in our Corporate Governance Guidelines, the Nominating & Governance Committees will, when appropriate, make recommendations to the Boards with respect to potential successors to the Chief Executive Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All members of the Boards will work with the Nominating & Governance Committees to see that qualified candidates are available and that development plans are being utilized to strengthen the skills and qualifications of the candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When assessing the qualifications of potential successors to the Chief Executive Officer, the Boards and the Nominating & Governance Committees will take into account our business strategy as well as any other criteria they believe are relevant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Procedures Regarding Director Candidates Recommended by Shareholders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating & Governance Committees will also consider shareholder recommendations of qualified director nominees when such recommendations are submitted in accordance with the procedures below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to have a nominee considered by the Nominating & Governance Committees for election at the 2018 Annual Meetings, a shareholder must provide the same information as is required for shareholders to submit Director nominations under the advance notice provision set forth in Carnival Corporations by-laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specifically, any such recommendation must include, in addition to any other requirements specifically set forth in Carnival Corporations and Carnival plcs governing documents:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the name and address of the candidate;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: investment company for at least the last five years;   a statement of the particular experience, qualifications, attributes or skills of the candidate, taking into account the qualification requirements set forth above; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the candidates signed consent to serve as a Director if elected and to be named in the Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Once we receive the recommendation, we may deliver to the candidate a questionnaire that requests additional information about the candidates independence, qualifications and other matters that would assist the Nominating & Governance Committees in evaluating the candidate, as well as certain information that must be disclosed about the candidate in our Proxy Statement or other regulatory filings, if nominated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Candidates must complete and return the questionnaire within the time frame provided to be considered for nomination by the Nominating & Governance Committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For our 2018 Annual Meetings of Shareholders, the Nominating & Governance Committees will consider recommendations received by our Secretary at our headquarters no later than October 27, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Code of Business Conduct and Ethics
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Carnival Corporation and Carnival plcs Code of Business Conduct and Ethics applies to all employees and members of the Boards of Carniva Corporation and Carnival plc and provides guiding principles on areas such as identifying and resolving conflicts of interest.

sentences.text: Our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics is posted on our website at www.carnivalcorp.com and www.carnivalplc.com.

sentences.text: The Code of Business Conduct and Ethics may be amended periodically to remain in line with best practices.

sentences.text: DIRECTOR COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During fiscal 2016, our Non-Executive Directors were entitled to receive an annual retainer of $110,000 per year, equity compensation, as further described below, and reimbursement for travel, meals and accommodation expenses attendant to their Board membership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not provide retirement benefits or other benefits to our Non-Executive Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We reimburse Directors for travel expenses incurred for spouses or partners when we request that they attend a special event.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any amount reimbursed for spousal or partner travel is reported below in the Director Compensation for Fiscal 2016 table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For fiscal 2016, the Presiding Director received an additional retainer of $25,000 per annum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, Non- Executive Directors receive additional compensation for serving as Chairperson of a Board Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board members who are employed by us do not receive additional compensation for their services as a member of the Boards of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During fiscal 2016, the retainer for the Chairperson of Board Committees were as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Committee    Chairperson Retainer   Audit Committees    $ 30,000   Compensation Committees    $ 30,000   Executive Committees         HESS Committees    $ 30,000   Nominating & Governance Committees    $ 15,000
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: he Boards of Directors are committed to attracting and retaining a highly diverse, experienced and capable group of Non-Executive Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: T at end, the compensation program for the Non-Executive Directors is evaluated annually by the Compensation Committees to ensure it i ompetitive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-Executive Directors receive payment of their earned retainer in quarterly installments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual retainers are pro-rated so that adjustments can be made during the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unearned portions of cash retainers are forfeited upon termination of service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-Executive Directors receive annual restricted share grants under the Carnival Corporation 2011 Stock Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In April 2016, the Non-Executive Directors received grants with a dollar value equal to approximately $160,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following policies also apply to our Non-Executive Directors:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership Policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The stock ownership policy for Non-Executive Directors provides that all Non-Executive Directors are required to own shares (inclusive of unvested restricted shares, RSUs and shares in a trust beneficially owned by the Director) of either Carnival Corporation common stock or Carnival plc ordinary shares with a value equal to four times the cash retainer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: New Directors must achieve this requirement no later than five years from the date of their initial election to the Boards by the shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the Non-Executive Directors elected in 2016 has already achieved this Board-mandated requirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Product Familiarization.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All Non-Executive Directors are encouraged to take a cruise for up to 14 days per year for product familiarization and pay a fare of $35 per day for such cruises.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, guests traveling with the Non-Executive Director in the same stateroom are charged a fare of $35 per day.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All other charges associated with the cruise (e.g., air fares, fuel supplements, fees, taxes and other charges, gratuities, ground transfers and tours) are the responsibility of the Non-Executive Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: DIRECTOR INDEPENDENCE AND RELATED PERSON TRANSACTIONS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independence of Board Members
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Boards of Directors have determined that each of the following Directors is an independent director in accordance with the corporate governance rules of the New York Stock Exchange as a result of having no material relationship with Carnival Corporation & plc other than (1) serving as a Director and Board Committee member, (2) receiving related fees as disclosed in this Proxy Statement and (3) having beneficial ownership of Carnival Corporation and/or Carnival plc securities as disclosed in the section of this Proxy Statement entitled Share Ownership of Certain Beneficial Owners and Management: Sir Jonathon Band, Helen Deeble, Richard J. Glasier, Debra Kelly-Ennis, Sir John Parker, Stuart Subotnick, Laura Weil and Randall J. Weisenburger.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Review and Approval of Transactions with Related Persons
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with our written policies and procedures, it is our practice to review all relationships and transactions in which Carnival Corporation & plc and our Directors, nominees and executive officers or their immediate family members are participants to determine whether such persons have a direct or indirect material interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Legal and Global Accounting and Reporting Services Departments are primarily responsible for the development and implementation of processes and controls to obtain
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Independence and Related Person Transactions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: information from the Directors, nominees and executive officers with respect to related person transactions and for then determining, based on the facts and circumstances, whether we or a related person has a direct or indirect material interest in the transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As required under SEC rules, transactions in which the amount involved exceeds $120,000 in which Carnival Corporation & plc was or is to be a participant and a related person had or will have a direct or indirect material interest are disclosed in our Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, in accordance with our Schedule of Matters Reserved to the Boards and their Committees for their Decision, the Boards review and approve or ratify any related person transaction involving (1) a Director, regardless of the amount and (2) a Non-Director Executive Officer with an aggregate value in excess of $50,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the course of its review and approval or ratification of a related person transaction, the Boards may consider factors as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the nature of the related persons interest in the transaction;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the material terms of the transaction, including, without limitation, the amount and type of transaction
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the importance of the transaction to the related person;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the importance of the transaction to Carnival Corporation & plc
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: whether the transaction would impair the judgment of a Director or executive officer to act in our best interest; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any member of the Boards who is a related person with respect to a transaction under review may not participate in the deliberations or vote respecting approval or ratification of the transaction, provided, however, that such Director may be counted in determining the presence of a quorum at a meeting of the Board that considers the transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Transactions with Related Persons
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Transactions with Micky Arison.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Micky Arison, our Chairman, is also the Chairman, President and the indirect sole shareholder of FBA II, Inc., the general partner of Miami Heat Limited Partnership (MHLP), the owner of the Miami Heat, a professional basketball team.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He is also the indirect shareholder of Basketball Properties, Inc., the general partner of Basketball Properties, Ltd. (BPL), the manager and operator of the American Airlines Arena.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to a three-year advertising and promotion agreement between Carnival Cruise Line, MHLP and BPL, Carnival Cruise Line paid $507,500 during fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Carnival Cruise Line also paid $40,000 during fiscal 2016 for in-game promotions to publicize Carnival Cruise Line during Miami Heat games.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In August 2015, Carnival Corporation entered into the following agreements:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) a nonexclusive Aircraft Lease Agreement with an owner trustee under a trust agreement with AD Astra I, LLC (the Lease Agreement) and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) a Services Agreement with AFO, LLC (the Services Agreement and together with the Services Agreement, the Aircraft Agreements).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Both AD Astra I, LLC and AFO, LLC are companies directly or indirectly controlled by a trust of which Mr. Arison is a beneficiary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the terms of the Lease Agreement, Carnival Corporation leases an aircraft owned by AD Astra I, LLC for additional flight capacity from time- to-time in exchange for an hourly rent of $4,500 plus applicable taxes, which is based on market charter rates for similar aircraft as adjusted for costs of operations borne by Carnival Corporation (i.e., fuel, crew costs and line maintenance during its operation of the aircraft) and hourly service plan expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the terms of the Service Agreement, Carnival Corporation provides aircraft management services to AFO, LLC with respect to the aircraft, including overseeing its operation, maintenance, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, Carnival Corporation will be reimbursed for operating, maintenance and personnel costs and related third party costs incurred in connection with the services (Service Costs).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The terms of the Aircraft Agreements are one year and renew automatically for one-year periods, unless terminated sooner by either party upon 30 days written notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During fiscal 2016, Carnival Corporation paid AD Astra I, LLC $775,100 under the Lease Agreement, and AFO, LLC paid Carnival Corporation $216,000 for the Service Fee and reimbursed Carnival Corporation $1,877,600 for the Service Costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Registration Rights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to a letter agreement (the Trust Registration Rights Agreement) dated July 11, 1989, Carnival Corporation granted to the Ted Arison Irrevocable Trust (the Irrevocable Trust) and the Arison Childrens Irrevocable Trust (the Childrens Trust, and together with the Irrevocable Trust, the Trusts) certain registration rights with respect to certain shares of Carnival Corporation common stock held for investment by the Trusts (the Shares).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The beneficiaries of the Trusts included the children of Ted Arison, including Micky Arison, our Chairman, and Shari Arison.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effective December 26, 1991, the Childrens Trust was divided into three separate continued trusts, including continued trusts for Micky Arison, Shari Arison and Michael Arison.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Trust Registration Rights Agreement, Carnival Corporation has granted the Trusts demand and piggyback registration rights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Carnival Corporation is not required to effect any demand registration unless all of the Shares owned by either of the Trusts are included in the demand.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Carnival Corporation has agreed to bear all expenses relating to such demand and piggyback registrations, except for fees and disbursements of counsel for the Trusts, selling costs, underwriting discounts and applicable filing fees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under a registration rights agreement dated June 14, 1991, as amended by an amendment dated July 31, 1991 and a succession agreement dated May 28, 2002 (together, the Arison Registration Rights Agreement), Carnival Corporation granted certain registration rights to Ted Arison with respect to certain shares of common stock beneficially owned by him (the Arison Shares) in consideration for $10,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The registration rights were held by the Estate of Ted Arison.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Estate of Ted Arison subsequently transferred the Arison Shares to various trusts for the benefit of Ted Arisons children (collectively, the Family Trusts).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Arison Registration Rights Agreement provides the Family Trusts and certain transferees with demand and piggyback registration rights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Carnival Corporation has agreed to bear all expenses relating to such demand and piggyback registrations, except for fees and disbursements of counsel for the Family Trusts, selling costs, underwriting discounts and applicable filing fees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As required by the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (the Dodd-Frank Act) and pursuant to Section 14A of the Exchange Act, our shareholders are being provided with the opportunity to cast an advisory (non-binding) vote to approve our executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We refer to this vote as the say-on-pay vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although this vote is advisory and is not binding on the Boards, the Compensation Committees will take into account the outcome of the vote when considering future executive compensation decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The say-on-pay vote is required to be offered to our shareholders at least once every three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2011, our shareholders recommended that we provide them with the opportunity to cast their say-on-pay vote each year and our Boards have accepted that recommendation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are asking shareholders to again vote on the frequency of the say-on-pay vote in Proposal 12.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If we maintain our current frequency, it is anticipated that the next say-on-pay vote will be at the 2018 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Boards are committed to corporate governance best practices and recognize the significant interest of shareholders in executive compensation matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committees seek to balance short-term and longer-term compensation opportunities to enable Carnival Corporation and Carnival plc to meet short-term objectives while continuing to produce value for their shareholders over the long-term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: They also promote a compensation program designed to attract, motivate and retain key executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As discussed in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, the Compensation Committees believe that our current executive compensation program directly links executive compensation to our performance and aligns the interests of our Named Executive Officers with those of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: compensation) than fixed remuneration.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with the Compensation Committees focus on long-term shareholder return, they approved performance-based share grants for our Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The grants vest zero to 200% based upon the extent to which annual operating income, as adjusted for fuel price changes and foreign currency exchange rate impacts, for each of the three fiscal years in the 2016-2018 performance cycle and return on invested capital (ROIC) exceeds specified performance goals over the three-year performance cycle and as modified up or down by up to 10% at the end of the three-year performance cycle for Carnival Corporations TSR rank relative to the Peer Group (defined below).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: requirements.

sentences.text: The Compensation Committees review the position of each element of total direct compensation relative to the competitive market, and use the range of total direct compensation levels in the competitive market to assess the extent to which the compensation provided to our Named Executive Officers is generally consistent with that offered by the competitive market to their named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ADVISORY (NON-BINDING) VOTE ON HOW FREQUENTLY SHAREHOLDERS SHOULD VOTE TO APPROVE COMPENSATION OF THE NAMED EXECUTIVE OFFICERS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As required by the Dodd-Frank Act, our shareholders are being provided with the opportunity to cast an advisory (non-binding) vote on how frequently our shareholders should have an advisory (non-binding) vote on the compensation of our Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We refer to this vote as the say-on-frequency vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although this vote is advisory and is not binding on the Boards, the Compensation Committees will take into account the outcome of the vote when considering how frequently to hold say-on-pay votes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may choose from the following alternatives: every year, every two years, every three years or you may abstain.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The say-on-frequency vote is required to be offered to our shareholders at least once every six years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the April 2011 shareholders meeting, the Boards of Directors recommended, and the shareholders voted on an advisory, non-binding basis in favor of, holding the say-on-pay vote every year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Boards accepted our shareholders recommendation and currently, shareholders are provided with the opportunity to cast an advisory (non-binding) vote to approve the compensation of our Named Executive Officers every year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Boards believe that having an annual say-on-pay vote to approve the compensation of our Named Executive Officers in satisfaction of U.S. disclosure rules is appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In this regard, we note that our shareholders are already provided with an annual vote to approve the Carnival plc Directors Remuneration Report (see Proposal 13), which covers all directors and includes the Compensation Discussion and Analysis (itself a significant portion of the executive compensation disclosure that is the subject of the say-on-pay vote).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Moreover, the boards believe that annual say-on-pay votes permit the Boards to receive current feedback on a timely basis from our shareholders regarding our compensation program for our Named Executive Officers, which will enable us to implement more quickly any modifications that the Boards determine to be appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Boards of Directors unanimously recommend that you vote in favor of holding a non-binding advisory vote every year to approve the compensation of our Named Executive Officers as disclosed pursuant to the compensation disclosure rules of the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with Section 439 of the Companies Act 2006 and Schedule 8 of the Large and Medium Sized Companies and Groups (Accounts and Reports) Regulations 2008 (the LMCG Regulations), shareholders are voting to approve adoption of the Carnival plc Directors Remuneration Report (other than the Carnival plc Directors Remuneration Policy set out in Section B of Part II of the Carnival plc Directors Remuneration Report).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Carnival plc Directors Remuneration Report is in two parts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Part I also constitutes the Compensation Discussion and Analysis as required by regulations promulgated by the SEC, and includes information that Carnival plc is required to disclose in accordance with the LMCG Regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Part II of the Carnival plc Directors Remuneration Report is set forth as Annex B to this Proxy Statement and includes the additional information that Carnival plc is required to disclose in accordance with the LMCG Regulations, including certain information which has been audited for the purposes of the Carnival plc Annual Report.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other than the Carnival plc Directors Remuneration Policy set out in Section B of Part II of the Carnival plc Directors Remuneration Report (as to which, please see Proposal 14), UK law only requires an advisory vote on the substance and content of the Carnival plc Directors Remuneration Report.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, disapproval of this Proposal 13 will not require us to amend the report or require any Director to repay any amount.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Boards and Compensation Committees are expected to take into account both the voting result and the views of our shareholders in their application, development and implementation of remuneration policies and plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Boards of Directors unanimously recommend a vote FOR the approval of the Carnival plc Directors Remuneration Report.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 14 APPROVAL OF CARNIVAL PLC DIRECTORS REMUNERATION POLICY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with Section 439A of the Companies Act 2006 and Schedule 8 of the LMCG Regulations, shareholders are voting to approve the Carnival plc Directors Remuneration Policy set out in Section B of Part II of the Carnival plc Directors Remuneration Report.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy has consciously been drafted broadly to give the Compensation Committees sufficient flexibility to act in the interests of Carnival Corporation and Carnival plc and their shareholders as, under the revised UK legislative requirements, payments may not be made to Directors outside of an agreed policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If approved, the Carnival plc Directors Remuneration Policy will take effect immediately following its approval at the 2017 Annual Meetings and will apply until it is replaced by a new or amended policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon the Carnival plc Directors Remuneration Policy becoming effective on the date of shareholder approval, remuneration payments to directors of Carnival plc (including former or proposed Directors) and payments for loss of office to a Director of Carnival plc (including a former or a proposed Director) will need to be consistent with the approved Carnival plc Directors Remuneration Policy or otherwise approved by an ordinary resolution of our shareholders (unless the payment is required to be made as part of a legal obligation entered into before June 27, 2012 and such obligation has not been amended or renewed since).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section B of Part II of the Carnival plc Directors Remuneration Report sets out the Boards remuneration policy for the next and subsequent fiscal years and other details required by the LMCG Regulations and the UK Corporate Governance Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: and CARNIVAL PLC DIRECTORS REMUNERATION REPORT  PART I
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Introduction
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Carnival Corporation and Carnival plc are separate legal entities (together referred to in this report as Carnival Corporation & plc) and each company has its own Board of Directors and Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, as is required by the agreements governing the dual listed company (DLC) arrangement, the Boards of Directors and members of the Committees of the Boards, including the Compensation Committees, are identical and there is a single senior management team.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Carnival Corporation and Carnival plc are subject to disclosure regimes in the U.S. and UK.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While some of the disclosure requirements are the same or similar, some are very different.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, the Carnival plc Directors Remuneration Report is in two parts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The information contained in this Part I constitutes the Compensation Discussion and Analysis as required by regulations promulgated by the SEC, and includes information that Carnival plc is required to disclose in accordance with Sections 439 and 440 of the Companies Act 2006 and Schedule 8 of the Large and Medium- Sized Companies and Groups (Accounts and Reports) Regulations 2008, as amended (the LMCG Regulations).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Part II of the Carnival plc Directors Remuneration Report is set forth as Annex B to this Proxy Statement and includes the additional information that Carnival plc is required to disclose in accordance with Section 439A of the Companies Act 2006 and the LMCG Regulations, including certain information that has been audited for the purposes of the Carnival plc Annual Report.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Parts I and II of the Carnival plc Directors Remuneration Report are in compliance with the LMCG Regulations, the UK Corporate Governance Code published in September 2014 by the UK Financial Reporting Council (the UK Corporate Governance Code), the UK Companies Act 2006 and the Listing Rules of the UK Listing Authority.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Both Parts I and II form part of the Annual Report of Carnival plc for the year ended November 30, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Discussion and Analysis and Carnival plc Directors Remuneration ReportPart I
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Summary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program is designed to reward financial results and effective strategic leadership through use of both short-term rewards and long-term incentives and to promote alignment of the financial interests of our Executive Officers with our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We seek to provide total direct compensation (salary, bonus and equity grants) that allows us to be competitive in the labor markets where we compete for executive talent, adjusted as necessary to take into consideration factors including the senior executives performance, experience and responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe our compensation programs performance measures align the interests of our shareholders and senior executives by linking actual pay to operating performance and shareholder outcomes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation philosophy has historically been to emphasize at risk incentive pay in order to drive a pay-for-performance culture.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In urtherance of this philosophy, all direct compensation for our Named Executive Officers, other than base salary, is 100% at risk and performance- based.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Compensation Practices and Policies   What we do        All compensation is performance-based and not guaranteed, other than base salary          Use multiple performance metrics to align pay with performance          Put caps on incentive compensation          Provide appropriate balance between short-term and long-term compensation to discourage short-term risk taking at the expense of long-term results          Set rigorous stock ownership requirements for Named Executive Officers (values equal to a target multiple of base salary) who must retain at least 50% of any net share-based awards received until their target ownership is achieved          Increased the target share ownership level applicable to the Chairman and/or the Chief Executive Officer from five times base salary to six times base salary          Include clawback provisions in our incentive programs          Provide for only double-trigger change-in-control provisions          Prohibit short sales, short-term hedging and margin accounts of Carnival Corporation and Carnival plc shares          Engage an independent compensation consultant to review and advise on executive compensation            Regularly review the Compensation Committee charter to ensure best practices and priorities   What we dont do          Provide guaranteed minimum bonuses          Reload, reprice or back-date stock options          Grant stock options with an exercise price less than fair market value          Provide tax gross-ups on compensation or benefits          Pay dividends on unvested or unearned performance-based share awards            Provide for automatic single-trigger vesting acceleration in connection with a change-in-control
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder Engagement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Carnival Corporation & plc has a long-standing shareholder outreach program and routinely interacts with shareholders on a number of matters, including executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committees consider all feedback received about executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In April 2016, shareholders approved our say-on-pay proposal with 95.8% of the votes cast in favor of the compensation paid to our Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During the past year we have continued to engage with shareholders and seek feedback on our compensation program and ncorporate the results of that feedback in our compensation decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, the Compensation Committees did not make any changes to the executive compensation program specifically as result of the 2016 say-on-pay vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committees have and will continue to consider results from the annual shareholder advisory votes, including the next vote in April 2017, as well as other shareholder input, when reviewing executive compensation programs and policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fiscal 2016 Company Performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We experienced strong financial and operating performance in fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our solid operational and financial performance in fiscal 2016 reflects senior leaderships focus on executing our business strategies effectively to achieve our goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This focus enabled us to deliver value to our shareholders in fiscal 2016, through our efforts to improve as we continue to build for future success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Increased fiscal 2016 net income by 58% to $2.8 billion or $3.72 diluted earnings per share compared to $1.8 billion or $2.26 in fiscal 2016, while also increased adjusted net income by 40% to $2.6 billion or $3.45 adjusted diluted earnings per share in fiscal 2016 compared to $2.1 billion or $2.70 in fiscal 2015 (1)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Continued to generate strong cash from operations of $5.1 billion in fiscal 2016 compared to $4.5 billion in fiscal 2015
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Returned $3.3 billion to shareholders through the combination of dividends and share repurchases
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Well on our way to reaching our objective of double-digit ROIC, while maintaining a strong balance sheet and strong investment grade credit ratings
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Achieved credit rating upgrades from both Standard & Poors and Moodys as a result of our sustained earnings improvement and continued balance sheet strength
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accelerated progress on our cost containment efforts resulting in $95 million of savings in fiscal 2016, bringing the cumulative savings to date to over $190 million
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Launched the initial phase of our state-of-the-art revenue management system, which will help us drive incremental revenue yield over time
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Implemented strategies to grow demand by increasing consumer awareness and consideration of our cruise brands and the global cruise industry through ongoing public relations efforts and advertising
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Launched three original TV programs that are airing on major U.S. networks, reaching viewers during the family-oriented programming blocks, showcasing ocean travel as a means to experience global destinations and learn about other cultures
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Introduced three new ships during fiscal 2016: AIDAPrima, Carnival Vista and ms Koningsdam
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Progressed in developing and implementing cutting-edge proprietary technology to enhance our ability to monitor and track ship nautical and technical performance in real time including fuel consumption and emissions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporation Operating Income Target established by the Compensation Committees for fiscal 2016 and the Compensation Committees philosophy o place greater emphasis on performance-based pay elements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following the end of fiscal 2016, the Compensation Committees confirmed preliminary funding bonus amounts for the Named Executive Officers based on the actual Corporation Operating Income and Brand Operating Income results achieved during fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the terms of the Management Incentive Plan, the Compensation Committees then considered other factors deemed relevant to the performance of Carnival Corporation & plc and the individual brands.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: One such factor was our HESS performance, as determined by the HESS Committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To make this annual determination, the HESS Committees met regularly with members of the Maritime Policy & Analysis Department and senior management to review an extensive analysis of each brands and Carnival Corporation & plcs enterprise-wide performance in HESS-related areas tracked throughout the course of the fiscal year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on its review of the HESS performance and other factors, the Compensation Committees approved adjustments to actual Corporation Operating Income and Brand Operating Income for fiscal 2016 to take into account the effects of gains on ship sales, restructuring expenses and litigation expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After taking all of these adjustments into consideration, the Compensation Committees certified an adjusted Corporation Operating Income amount for fiscal 2016 that was 105.2% of the fiscal 2016 Corporation Operating Income Target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This amount was also 28% higher than the Corporation Operating Income for fiscal 2015 (which was also determined taking into account similar adjustments), and resulted in a preliminary bonus equal to 152.5% of Messrs. Donald, Bernstein and Buckelews target bonus.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The adjusted Corporation Operating Income, performance levels and resulting actual performance level payouts for fiscal 2016 as approved by the Compensation Committees were as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Actual Results and Payout Adjusted  Fiscal 2016  Corporation Operating Income (in thousands)    Actual  Percent of Target Achieved    Actual Fiscal 2016 Payout Percentage $3,297    105.2%    152.5%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committees also certified an adjusted Brand Operating Income amount for the Holland America Group for fiscal 2016 that was 104.0% of its 2016 Brand Operating Income Target and for the Costa Group that was 100.4% of its 2016 Brand Operating Income Target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When these fiscal 2016 brand results, inclusive of their respective HESS modifiers, were combined with the adjusted Corporate Operating Income results described above, the result was preliminary funding for Messrs. Kruse and Thamm, equal to 150.4% and 105.5% of their respective target bonuses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Donald made recommendations to the Compensation Committees for all Named Executive Officer annual bonuses except for his own.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The recommendations included a subjective review of the applicable fiscal year overall performance of each Named Executive Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Donald also submitted his self-assessments to the Compensation Committees summarizing his own activities and results as compared to his goals, as well as Carnival Corporation & plcs overall performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Final bonus amounts were then determined by the Compensation Committees, taking into account Mr. Donalds recommendations and input from FW Cook.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In making their determinations, including whether to vary bonuses from the amount determined under the bonus schedule included in the Management Incentive Plan, the Compensation Committees considered the factors summarized in the Executive Summary above, in addition to the competitive market compensation for each Named Executive Officer and its subjective overall assessment of individual performance in fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After taking into account the factors referred to above, together with an assessment of the individual performance of each of the Named
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
